channel.title: Need help with some real java
channel.description:
Kay
Say for example i had:
[code] public int[] i = new int[3]; [/code]
And i[0] was set to 3, i[1] was set to 5, i[2] was set to 4, and i[3] was set to 1.
Basically in easier terms:
[code] i[0] = 3; i[1] = 5; i[2] = 4; i[3] = 1; [/code]
Right, how would i make an alternative int like this:
[code] int highestNumber = (*); [/code]
Basically i want (*) to select the biggest integer out of the i[] int. So in that case i would want it to automatically select i[1] as it has the largest amount, that's what i need help with.
[b]ALSO[/b]
How could i reset all of those int's to 0 in one easy code?
Thanks.

item.title: Need help with some real java
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

[quote=“Graham, post:5, topic:191329”]Nope - second question would be:

for(int i = 0; i < thearray.length(); i++) { thearray[i] = 0; } [/quote]

Yeah figured that ages ago just my stupid c+ping lol.

Thanks anyway

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with some real java

item.title: Need help with some real java
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

Nope - second question would be:

for(int i = 0; i < thearray.length; i++)
{
    thearray[i] = 0;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with some real java
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

This isn’t exactly real Java… It’s standard array usage in any language derived from or similar to C/++

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with some real java

item.title: Need help with some real java
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

And then for the second question;

for(int i = 0; i < thearray.length(); i++)
{
if(thearray > highestNumber)
{
i[thearray] = 0;
}
}

Mhmm?

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with some real java

item.title: Need help with some real java
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

int highestNumber = 0;
for(int i = 0; i < thearray.length; i++)
{
    if(thearray[i] > highestNumber)
    {
        highestNumber = thearray[i];
    }
}

Read full topic

item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

Kay

Say for example i had:

public int[] i = new int[3];

And i[0] was set to 3, i[1] was set to 5, i[2] was set to 4, and i[3] was set to 1.

Basically in easier terms:

i[0] = 3;
i[1] = 5;
i[2] = 4;
i[3] = 1;

Right, how would i make an alternative int like this:

int highestNumber = (*);

Basically i want (*) to select the biggest integer out of the i[] int. So in that case i would want it to automatically select i[1] as it has the largest amount, that’s what i need help with.

ALSO

How could i reset all of those int’s to 0 in one easy code?

Thanks.
